attributes.action: Call upon the Government to pass a law, amending the British Constitution, which does exist in written form, though not in one single document. The new law should make it impossible for the Westminster Parliament to transfer powers to the European Parliament without the explicit consent, by referendum, of the British People. This is an issue which should have cross-party consent. If possible, the law should be applied retrospectively, indicating that the current Prime Minister’s assent to the Treaty of Lisbon be declared null and void.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I have searched the resolutions listed here. Although some make points which are similar, none, as far as I can see, make this specific point.
Some make a call for constitutional reform. This is definitely right and should be pursued.
The first step should be to introduce legally binding, obligatory by law referendums for any transference of power from the Westminster Parliament to the European Parliament.
This should be an issue which has cross-party consent and should have been passed decades ago. British Prime Ministers in the 1970’s used to allow referendums  on this. At this time, the British Constitution, should have been amended to ensure that all subsequent Prime Minister’s were legally obliged to do so.
